title: Exploring the Potential of Large Multimodal Models as Effective Alternatives for Pronunciation Assessment
author: Ke Wang (Microsoft, Beijing, China), Lei He (Microsoft, Beijing, China), Kun Liu (Microsoft, Beijing, China), Yan Deng (Microsoft, Beijing, China), Wenning Wei (Microsoft, Beijing, China), Sheng Zhao (Microsoft, Beijing, China), ...
relevance_why: This paper explores the use of Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) like GPT-4o for pronunciation assessment, which directly relates to Dr. Liu's interest in generative models for audio applications and could inform future enhancements in speech technology and language learning tools.
background: The paper investigates how LMMs assess pronunciation quality across different granularities (phonemes, words, and sentences) and provides feedback to language learners.
contribution: This paper introduces the application of Large Multimodal Models for pronunciation assessment tasks, achieving competitive results against traditional methods while providing comprehensive feedback.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods mainly relied on align-based techniques using Automatic Speech Recognition, which can be cumbersome and less adaptable.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by leveraging multimodal capabilities to assess pronunciation in an alignment-free manner, thus simplifying the assessment process.

key_innovation: The integration of traditional pronunciation assessments with LMMs allows for real-time feedback and scoring across multiple levels of linguistic granularity.
real_world_impact: The findings may significantly enhance computer-assisted language learning tools, enabling more tailored and effective feedback mechanisms for language learners.
limitations: The study lacks ground-truth feedback, which poses a challenge in validating the results accurately.

new_terms.Goodness of Pronunciation (GOP): **Goodness of Pronunciation** is a scoring metric used to quantify the accuracy and quality of pronunciation in spoken language assessments.
new_terms.multimodal model: **Multimodal model** refers to a model that can process and integrate multiple types of data inputs, such as text, audio, and visual information, to perform tasks effectively.
